alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 6:33AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following counties, Boone, Lincoln and Logan. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hamlin, Spurlockville, Gill, Harts, Julian, Mud, Palermo, Alkol, Yawkey, Griffithsville, Woodville, Sweetland and Myra. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
